posts.caption:
"üé≤I had an epic game night last night and I finally got to experience Everdell! 

üå≥The cards and meeples are absolutely adorable, not to mention the glorious Evertree in the middle of the beautiful board. I definitely have a soft spot for animals. It was fun to see how the buildings and critters paired together. 

Since I only played once, it's difficult to comment on the overall strategy, but it did  seem like there were variable approaches to success, which is nice. I had a good time playing Everdell, however, I prefer games that have more player interaction involved. There was the opportunity to block key spaces and ride that out as long as possible, and potentially take cards that may have been valuable to your opponents, but other than that, I didn't feel like there was much I could do to affect my neighbours. Is there a solo mode in Everdell? I feel like this is the type of game I would prefer in a solo environment. Just myself, a mission and a pretty theme. 

Have you played Everdell? What are your thoughts? 

#everdell #nature #meeples #animals #critters #fantasy #forest #meadow #pretty #boardgames #gamer #tabletopgames #games #gaming #brettspiel #juegosdemesa #tree #jeuxdesociete #nerd #geek  #photooftheday #coins #gamenight #cardgame #resources #play"
A throwback photo of Martin Lawrence playing what game on what gaming console? üéÆüèà

Level 99 is the ultimate destination for gamers and fun-seekers alike. With over 50 gaming rooms, both physical and mental challenges, and a local art scene, this gaming center is a must-visit. Plus, enjoy a meal or drink at the connected restaurant and bar. Whether you're a competitive gamer or just looking for a fun night out, Level 99 has something for everyone.
